ratings.comment: Caron was a great professor. His lectures were organized and interesting and he made it possible to pass the class by telling you what he was expecting. There were no between the line kind of questions. Thankful to have had him for his final year at UW- Madison.

Roberts actually cares and gives really interesting lectures with lots of personal details. Very funny and rarely boring. Records all lectures and uploads them quickly. Overall, great guy. Always draws smiley faces in his O's (:

Caton cares about his students as long as you make an effort to get to know him. Quizzes are super easy and the tests are multiple choice. Attending lectures is necessary to succeed which wasn't hard since I actually enjoyed the material.

He is a great professor. He cares about his students a lot and wants them to be successful not just in his class but also in their furture. I am an international student, his class is hard for me. But if you need to take psych class, I definitely recommend him.
I liked Caton at first... then I didn't... but you know what. he kept it real from jump...... And thats why he's the best prsych professor in that university.

Caton is a great guy, super relatable, and understanding. He is funny and makes lecture super interesting- I looked forward to going to class. Attendance is basically necessary for you to succeed, while the textbook is completely irrelevant except for vocab words on the quiz. Tests are super straightforward, just really understand your lecture note

Caton is very rigid about everything, he has been using the same powerpoint for over 4 years. He is very available to talk to, but he will shut you down very quickly if you try to ask why you got something wrong on a test. Don't bother buying the text book & the two additional books he wants you to read, they were not needed. Lecutres are online.

Caton is by far my favorite professor! I've been told you don't need to read the textbook, however I think it's helpful to see the information written out as well. The exams are based on lecture only, which includes most of the information from the book. As long as you put in the time studying and attend PLA this will be an enjoyable class!

I was a freshman coming into this class & Caton was very rude. He yelled at me in front of many people for getting a D on the first exam. I then went to his office hours where he proceeded to tell me to drop the class and offered no advice. He made me feel extremely bad for being a student on financial aid and not being able to drop the course.
He's inspirational with his stories

worst professor I've ever had in my life. His information is outdated, he is rude and condescending and unprofessional. I am a psychology major and had already taken many psychology classes at a previous college, but I had to take this to get into higher level courses and I've never been so disappointed in a class or a professor in my life.

This isn't a terrible class, but it definitely wasn't my favorite. Caton covers material clearly, but talks about himself a lot. Tests are manageable if you literally memorize every scrap of material and can recall it without looking at your notes. Tests are entirely based on lecture and the PLA really helps to study for the exams.

Caton is an amazing professor, if you attend and focus on lecture and make sure to put in the work studying you can succeed.  He records and posts his lectures in case you miss a class, which is super helpful.  Join a PLA and go to office hours before exams and an A is extremely possible.  I would take a class with Caton again in a heartbeat!!!

Took this as an easy A class, stopped going to lecture halfway through the semester  and listened to them online instead because Caton called people out and talked about himself too much. Don't buy the books or textbook. Do the extra credit and PLA guides that he sends out. Everything from tests is from his lectures.

Caton adds a lot of supplemental material (three books, videos, articles) to the course besides the textbook. Join a PLA and do the extra credit - they help! Grade is made up of four exams and online quizzes that have the weight of an exam. I've heard he's a lot more difficult than other psych professors - I was always busy with this class.

He knows what he's teaching. Sometimes he has mid sentences pause to make sure students understand. Very nice professor. Join PLA and do the psych extra credit! You don't really need to read the TEXTBOOK. Quizzes are easy if you know how to use the internet (if you don't have the book). Exams based notes,  few book readings and videos in class

Caton is easily my favorite professor yet. He opened up class on the first day by telling the class about a psychotic break he had in high school after dropping acid. Lectures were interesting. Work is required for this class, but as long as you read the textbook and study for tests you're fine. PLA groups helped too. Offers lots of extra credit.

Caton is a solid professor. He gives great examples and does push his students. I 100% recommend doing a PLA group; it helps immensely with preparing for exams. However, my only negative comment about Caton is that he can get rather political; he often brings politics into his discussions when it truly isn't necessary. Overall, though, take  him.

Caton is a good guy. He genuinely cares about how his students perform. He goes out of his way to extend office hours in case you need help or didn't perform well on an exam. The class itself is structured nicely and you can get a lot of extra credit. His lectures are great and you can tell he really cares.

Psyc is a very challenging class, but Canton Roberts is a great teacher. It's important to take advantage of every extra credit opportunity he gives out because you will need it. Come to class, utilize the study methods he suggests and the notes he provides for lecture. If you put in the work, you'll do fine. If not you're in for a world of hurt.

Roberts was a great professor, I would definitely take him again. He offers up to 15 extra credit points (boosts your grade a half a letter grade) and his quizzes aren't that difficult. Lectures could get long, but that could be because it's a power lecture. The class overall isn't bad and his tests are hard but they definitely could be worse.

Professor Roberts is a  good professor that I had no problems with. Before class he always jammed to Jimi Hendrix which was pretty cool. If you join a PLA the tests will be relatively easy. Just put in the effort to do the PLA worksheets and you should do well. Professor Roberts seems tough in class but just pretend your discussing when he asks.

Caton is a professor who truly cares about his students and goes out of his way to add extra office hours in order to be accessible to students. As long as you attend lectures and pay attention, the class should be fairly straight forward. My recommendation is to join a PLA and regardless of attending the sessions fill out the outlines in depth.

Caton is an amazing professor with so much knowledge and so many life experiences. Pre-lecture quizzes are easy &  can usually be found online. Don't need the book except sometimes on quizzes. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT. Tests are a breeze if you join a PLA & memorize the outlines he provides. Lectures can be long just because it's a power lecture.

Well-versed and truly cares about the things he's lecturing on. As with any power lecture, it can be a bit slow at times. Plays Jimi Hendrix before classes. 5 point (online) quizzes frequent during the semester, nice grade boosters. Tests are fair if you do PLA outlines and actually try with them. Great guy! If you put in effort, an A is doable.

This class is completely reasonable.  I put in minimal work for an A.  Join a PLA just to get the outlines; Roberts writes them and there's nothing on the tests that's not on those outlines.  Plus, 15 extra credit points just for taking some surveys! As for online quizzes, they are the same as the free quizzes on the textbook website.
His tests are very hard and very poorly written.
genuinely cares about his students, tests are all fair,  use his question method, do the extra credit, and join a PLA and you should get a good grade with no problem

Caton knows the material like the back of his hand. It really helps to print out the lecture notes before lecture so that you can jot down additional notes + not have to worry about missing important info, as there is a lot. Tests are straight forward as long as you review the lecture notes throughly. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT (NOT HARD). Overall: GOOD

4 tests, no final. Pretty hard class, manageable if you put the time in. JOIN A PLA, the tests are pretty much the study guides you get. Dont read book,  reference it for vocab, do extra credit, helps a lot. Streams lectures in case you miss. Plays jimmy hendrix before class. Awesome guy, really cool. only read articles/books for last test.
Use his question method and concept maps and you will pass with an A. Think you don't need it and won't use it and you will fail. It's as simple as that. Take it seriously!
Literally the greatest professor you will ever have! Use the question method and concept maps and you will pass with flying colors.   Re-watch lectures and look at slides before each exam too.

Future students, listen to me when I say read every reading, DO THE QUESTION METHOD (it works!), go to office hours, make concept maps, pay attention in lectures and re-watch them later on Learn@UW and last, but not least, get ready to enjoy some awesome music before each lecture. Caton will go out of his way to make sure you succeed; work hard!
I found Caton to be well organized and passionate about the subject.

Clear concise and enjoyable class. Caton Roberts is dynamic, intense and humorous. Everything is really straightforward and the 4 non cumulative midterms (no final) are fair: no need to study the textbook to get an A. You'll still need it for weekly readings/ online homework.

Makes lectures interesting imo and sometimes humorous. Graded work is 4 NON-cumulative exams and online chapter quizzes. You get 3 attempts per quiz and it takes the highest one. No time limit either. Have your book out and those are easy. Recorded lectures and his notes are available online. As long as you care and try you should get at least a B.
He is a super good professor.  Very clear and tests are fair.  Gives extra credit so do that.  Join a PLA and you shouldn't have too much trouble getting an A.
Tests are so hard and go over so much material not taught or mentioned in lecture

He's a really cool guy, he definitely has a lot to share. Sometimes gets kind of far off topic in lecture, but overall a great guy. Posts recorded lectures online, but going is still recommended. Doesn't allow cellphone use during lecture. Tests are very heavy in lecture material.

He's a funny guy and really cares about his students. He's all about the "question method" when you study. DO the extra credit by volunteering in studies and participate in the Peer Learning Association, and you shouldn't have a problem getting an A in intro psych.
Best teacher I have ever had. A kind and intelligent professor who has fair exams that require lots of work and attention to class.

Caton really cares about his students and wants them to succeed, but his tests are unfair and hard. He asks questions that don't illustrate a students knowledge of the concepts but rather the students ability to memorize minescule facts. If you're looking for a class where you purely memorize and don't learn than take this course.

I would highly recommend taking Caton for your Psych 202 course. Read the book once and know the vocab words and figures, study your lecture notes, briefly read the other readings, and you will be fine. Caton is absolutely fair if you do these things, but more importantly, you will get something out of his class. Enjoyable and stimulating professor

Professor Roberts cares tremendously about his students. He is always available for extra help and he is very student friendly in his policies such as delaying homework deadlines if something came up. 202 is a tough class and he has high expectations, but it was refreshing taking a course with a professor who focused so much on his students
Loved Caton so much as a person, even when he goes off on his tangents. Was definitely one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. You really need to study as well as read the book.

Caton is very full of himself and likes to be wordy about things which I didn't like. However, he does give you the tools to succeed in the class. The tests aren't easy so make sure you study. Also, make sure psych interests you before you sign up

Caton is hilarious and knows his stuff but his tests are crazy hard. Unless you have a a natural aptitude for psych I recommend you study a ton. You can look forward to the wide range of music he plays from his iTunes before each lecture.

Lectures: Information overload, riddled with hints at possible exam ?s, very fast paced. HW: Don't read the book. 95% of Exam ?s come from lectures. Exams: HARD. Very specific. Some ?s said once. Advice:  Do all Extra Credit. Watch Lectures online. Reattach Videos and reread his PPTS. In summary, AVOID him.

Caton is awesome. People hate him sometimes because he's blunt and doesn't care what anyone thinks. He does go off on tangents, I will admit. But if that confuses you, then just go to the TA and ask questions. He is a fair grader and is very straightforward with everything the class entails. He lets you know exactly whats on the test.
He is boring, full of himself, and by the end of the class you will hate psych.
Goes off on a lot of tangents. Basically just reiterates what's in the text and reads off his slides. You basically teach yourself the class.
Take Caton's FIG! He's a really cool guy and his Contemplative Neuroscience class is eye-opening to say the least. His tests for 202 aren't that difficult, and he prepares you well.

Caton was the best! I wouldn't have wanted to take psych 202 with any other professor! I've heard from others that their tests are even harder and the lectures are boring. Caton's lectures are very intriguing and easy to understand! All you have to do is print out the notes outline and fill in the blanks.

I think psychology is really interesting, but for the life of me I could not focus for the entire class.  Caton is a nice guy, but I don't think he teaches that well.  I always went into the exams feeling prepared (I studied my notes thoroughly, read all the readings, and used his extra study materials) but never received good grades. :(

Caton is an overall great professor. For a 60 yr old man he is very enthusiastic. your grade will indeed have to be earned but it is indeed doable especially with the multiple extra credit that he offers to the class. take advantage of his "question method" that he teaches. It's so helpful. study in advance and read the books (short novels)

Caton is one of my favorite professors at Madison. His exams were difficult but fair--he posted lectures online, offered study sessions, extra credit, and was available to talk to. Exams require a lot of studying. Those who did poorly did not study enough. Wonderful class and very good, interesting, articulate professor.

Caton is an excellent professor.  He is passionate about psych and really knows his stuff.  Glance over the readings, but memorize your notes!  The exams are 80% notes.  Take advantage of the "study method" he tries to teach you; it will help you immensely!
I like him, he's pretty cool. I feel like sometimes he pulls ideas out of nowhere, though. But he is pretty cool and generally a very nice guy.
Caton is the best professor ever! Take this class with him ONLY!
I love Caton! One of my favorite professors- he is very calming and kind. Incredibly helpful and understanding, really wants students to do well in the class, and extra credit is offered

Confusing in lecture, but provides tons of resources to help clear things up, including lecture videos online, additional readings that reinforce topics, and videos. Very responsive to questions in the middle of tests and seems to actually care that people are learning, unlike a lot of professors.

Full of himself to the extreme!! Material is straightforward enough, but he is not a strong lecturer. Tells unrelated stories and takes forever to get to his point. I am a senior and decided to take this course because I was interested. He was a very unpleasant person to learn from, and I give every professor I have a chance. Avoid his course.
He is very helpful and knowledgable. His tests are hard but fair. All material is online so it's super easy to catch up if you are behind. He has a genuine interest in his students

Caton is probably the best psych 202 professor at the UW. He posts almost all of his material online so it is easy to catch up. Exams are difficult, but fair. The only poor thing I have to say about him is that he assigns extra readings that other professors don't. Also he is involved in PLA so join if you can! It helps a lot.

Can be challenging at times but as long as you print off the lecture notes and read the reading prior to going to class its a breeze. Midterms are from the lecture notes and diagrams in the book. It's really not hard to get an A in this class! Show up and stick with it
Extremely good teacher. Read additional readings and test questions are STRAIGHT from lecture notes, so make sure you know every corner of your notes. Best professor I've had at Madison.

He jumps around a lot and always tries to sound smart. I had to translate what he's really trying to say in my head to understand the material. The exams were killers. They asked questions regarding the details - things that he mentioned only once in class. Make sure to read the textbook and all the additional readings.
Caton is awesome, he he very responsible to the materials he talks about. More importantly, he records the class video clip, which is helpful to review.
Tests can be a little difficult, though is multiple choice.

Overall a very nice guy. Caton was great at answering Email questions promptly and more than willing to meet up in person as well for help. The main issue I had was that so many random readings and books were placed on top of the huge textbook. It made it very hard to know what to study, and where the focus was.

Great teacher, does a good job in getting you to understand the material. Additionally, he offered review session before just about every test. His exams were fairly tough and he asked some very specific questions that didn't quite seem fair. Overall, I had a good experience in Professor Roberts' class.

You will definitely get out what you put in for this course. 1)He offers review sessions before class that are REALLY helpful and he gives away potential test question answers. SO GO! 2)If you show interest, he'll make sure you succeed. 3)His T.A. is really helpful. 4) His tests are 95% lecture, 3% assigned readings (articles), and 2% textbook. :)

His ideas are all jumbled and hard to follow i though.  Also took AP psych in high school and passed AP test with a 3.  Took his class to be an easier class but still got a C in the class. Very difficult and confusing for a 3 credit class.
Caton is a fair teacher. His tests are all multiple choice and difficult, but there is a curve. The curve is also strict, but the Extra Credit can help you. You would be a fool to not do all the EC

Caton moves around a lot when he teaches, making it easier to stay focused. His exams are 90% based on lecture--I didn't read the book and I turned out mostly fine. Help can be hard to get from him because he'll want you to be able to figure out the answers for yourself. That said, he's a really awesome guy and he teaches really well!
Good teacher and passionate about the subject.  Classes are interesting.  Really cares about students and wants them to do well and gives them tips to do so
Very helpful, clear, and Caton definitely knows what he is talking about. The class is quite challenging, especially regarding the exams, but I have learned a lot in this psychology class.

I really loved Caton's class. Going to lecture was fun and the video recordings of the lectures were so helpful when studying for tests. However, it is a lot of work for a 3 credit class and many exam questions will be on the reading so there's no way to get around it. If you have to take intro to psych, take it with him!!!

Caton was really passionate about the course material and tried his best to clarify information during the class. He even made online videos of his lectures. The tests were pretty straight forward if you did the reading and attended lectures. No cum. final! GO TO LECTURE.

Excellent professor, my favorite of the semester. Very approachable and easy to connect with. Go to his office hours before exams, it helps a ton. Most of the information on the tests is from the notes, but some is from the book so READ. Know the vocab and italicized terms. If you study for the exams you'll easily pull off an AB or an A.

This class is pretty bad. A lot of material covered. The tests are entirely multiple choice, but many of the questions are worded really strangely. Caton is a really smart guy, but is not very open to questions and can be a little snotty at times. Don't take this class unless it is required for your major!

His stories are entertaining. He's funny at times. If you ask a question that is stupid he will let you know. Tests are ridiculous. Know every detail from the multiple chapters, videos, online readings, and chapter books. I was interested in majoring in psych. not anymore. Caton ruined it for me. way too much work for a 3 credit class. do the ec.

Caton is fantastic. He knows a lot from many disciplines, and has nice bits of wisdom. He's very smart, but isn't afraid to tell the class honestly when he doesn't know something. His lectures are very interesting, and have made me way more interested in the material. You've got to work hard, but if do, the class will be a blast.
Great class taught by a professor who keeps the topic interesting and relevant. Although his tests are pretty hard, you retain more from lecture when you're not wanting to fall asleep the whole time.

CANNOT STAND THIS MAN. Loves the sound of his own annoying voice. Can't stay on one topic for more than 90 seconds. Uses unnecessary large words to make himself sound smart, but hardly knows anything. Have to take notes and know mostly everything from the book. Do the all of the extra credit

Likes to hear himself talk, goes off on weird tangents. Great at connecting with students. Tests are fair and very hard, like all of the 202 classes. Just know everything. Memorize the power points and extra notes written during class. Know bold/italic terms in book. Do the extra credit!!!
Great professor. His lectures were great. He always makes them interesting and relevant. His tests weren't bad. If you know the book material and notes very well and you'll get an A or AB no problem.

Roberts is the most unhelpful professor I have ever had on campus. He thinks he's being a good teacher, but really he's just condescending. His lecture notes would be helpful if he actually got through them without droning on with irrelevant stories. He is extremely unapproachable and his tests are very hard. Memorize everything. Good luck.

The curve for the class sucks (not his fault. Just warning you. It is definitely a weed out class.  Its very hard to do well) The material is very interesting, but there is so much of it, and you simply need to KNOW everything for the tests. Hes a good guy, thinks hes funnier than he is.

I really enjoyed Caton's class and as far as i can tell he is one of the best psych professors at Madison.  Go to lecture! He intentinally leave out info in the the notes to make sure people come. I found the lectures to be very interactive and cool. Overall, eventhough i am not a psych major, i found the class very interesting and entertaining.

Roberts, I thought, was an overall good professor. Tests are hard, but he offers all of the study tools necessary to succeed in his class, you just need to take advantage of them. Make sure to read the textbook but you only need to pay attention to the pictures/charts and bold/italicized words.

Class was challenging (for a non-Psych major), but interesting.  Made lectures worth going to, even had review sessions every day before lecture (which I couldn't attend).  Not known for being completely student-friendly, but consider taking him for a worthwhile college experience.

Lecture is actually pretty interesting because Roberts puts some enthusiasm and humor into lectures.  Labeling the class as hard or easy is redundant because the psych department bell curve relies strictly on your scores relative to other students.  Definitely enjoyed having Roberts, but people have mixed opinions

A lot of people really like this guy for whatever reason, but he turned out to be the worst professor I've ever had. The class wasn't particularly challenging, but I couldn't stand going to lectures. He seemed very condescending in my opinion and made you feel stupid for asking questions. He was very full of himself and looked down on students.

Decent. I enjoyed the subjects covered. I learned most of the material from the textbook and the printed notes he provides. Lecture simply expands upon those. Exams were challenging but not impossible, and the opportunity for extra credit exists.

This class is extremely difficult.  Listen to every little topic discussed in lecture because it will be on the test.  He made me go from relatively interested in psych to no interest at all.  Though i do like the music at the beginning, this guy tries way too hard to be the "cool professor"
WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. TESTS ARE IMPOSSIBLE.  IF YOU HAVE ANY INTEREST IN PSYCHOLOGY DO NOT TAKE PROFESSOR ROBERTS OR YOU WILL NOT LIKE IT ANYMORE!
I did well in the class. You don't really have to read every detail in the textbook. Just review your notes.

The WORST professor ever!  Insensitive, rude, and loves to hear himself talk. He doesn't wear a microphone because of some psychology crap reason that he thinks is relavent. Ridiculously hard tests that just test memorization - especially figures from the book and useless things he has said in class.
Tells a lot of stories and wastes a lot of time doing that. He likes to rush through the important details when he realizes he is running out of time. You basically need to memorize everything!
